review: I thought when I ordered Chromecast that it would stream any source I can access on my laptop to the TV. But it actually only streams Netflix and YouTube out of the box.  It doesn't (yet) stream Amazon videos, which is the only source of decent  movies since Netflix has gone the mostly-TV route.  There is a fix you can set up on the PC that might allow Amazon to stream through the Chromecast but it takes more knowledge of Windows than I want to acquire.  Amazon, why don't you put out your version of Chromecast for us die-hard movie buffs?
author: Amazon Customer

review: This is probably the cheapest and best device you can buy that connects Netflix to a TV.  The Netflix phone client is really good.  Pandora is really good too.  Only thing Netflix needs to add is automatically going to the next episode.  Pandora needed a screen-saver when they launched, but they quickly added it.  Since it's integrated directly into the normal android clients, it's very good.  Compared to other STBs and smart TVs, that's a much better model.  The apps on my TV are terrible and will probably never get updated.Why only 4 stars?  Youtube is mediocre at best, mainly because Google shows ads and there is no ad-block yet for Chromecast.  I could mod my router to block Youtube ads, but that's too much work.  Casting Chrome to your TV is really bad though.  Latency is terrible.  Also, do not expect to be able to watch local media files because it's just too choppy.  Whether I stream from the laptop or fileserver, it's just not really usable.  You're much better just using a video cable directly connecting your computer to TV.So yeah, if you're looking for a small, cheap, simple device to get Netflix onto a TV with great usability, buy this.  If you're looking for anything else, move along.
